newsitem.title: UK: CE Electric dismissive of Northern defence.
newsitem.headline: CE Electric dismissive of Northern defence.

text.p: CE Electric said bid target Northern Electric's defence pushing dividend increases and cost savings was "an exercise in re-arranging the deckchairs on the good ship scorched earth."
CE Electric, which is 70 percent-owned by U.S. group CalEnergy, said it did not think "anything Northern has proposed is capable of delivering anything close to 650 pence to shareholders."

Northern said earlier on Tuesday it expected its final dividend to be up 17 percent at 50 pence per share and looked for dividned growth over seven percent to 2000 as part of a defence against CE Electric's 650 pence per share bid.
CE Electric raised its bid from 630 pence on Friday.
Last year, Northern successfully fended off Trafalgar House, now a unit of Kvaerner, with a 560 million stg package of benefits to shareholders.
